1. Introduction
MRCPv2 is designed to allow a client device to control media MRCPv2 is designed to allow a client device to control media
processing resources on the network. Some of these media processing processing resources on the network. Some of these media processing
resources include speech recognition engines, speech synthesis resources include speech recognition engines, speech synthesis
engines, speaker verification, and speaker identification engines. engines, speaker verification, and speaker identification engines.

Response platforms using VoiceXML [W3C.REC-voicexml20-20040316] Response platforms using VoiceXML [W3C.REC-voicexml20-20040316]
browsers or other client applications while maintaining separate browsers or other client applications while maintaining separate
back-end speech processing capabilities on specialized speech back-end speech processing capabilities on specialized speech
processing servers. MRCPv2 is based on the earlier Media Resource processing servers. MRCPv2 is based on the earlier Media Resource
Control Protocol (MRCP) [RFC4463] developed jointly by Cisco Systems, Control Protocol (MRCP) [RFC4463] developed jointly by Cisco
Inc., Nuance Communications, and Speechworks, Inc. Although some of Systems, Inc., Nuance Communications, and Speechworks, Inc.
the method names are similar, the way in which these methods are Although some of the method names are similar, the way in which
communicated is different. There are also more resources and more these methods are communicated is different. There are also more
methods for each resource. The first version of MRCP was essentially resources and more methods for each resource. The first version of
taken only as input to the development of this protocol. There is no MRCP was essentially taken only as input to the development of this
expectation that an MRCPv2 client will work with an MRCPv1 server or protocol. There is no expectation that an MRCPv2 client will work
vice versa. There is no migration plan or gateway definition between with an MRCPv1 server or vice versa. There is no migration plan or
the two protocols. gateway definition between the two protocols.
